issue.title: invalid character '-' in numeric literal ON WINDOWS
issue.body:
## Swagger specification
```
---
swagger: '2.0'
info:
  description: Test
  version: 0.0.1
  title: Test
host: test
basePath: /test/v1
schemes:
  - http
consumes:
  - application/json
produces:
  - application/json
paths:
  /test:
    post:
      operationId: test
      parameters:
        - name: body
          in: body
          required: true
          schema:
            $ref: '#/definitions/TestRequest'
      responses:
        200:
          description: OK
definitions:
  TestRequest:
    type: object
    properties:
      name:
        type: string
```

## Steps to reproduce
swagger validate ./test.yaml

Message:
```
The swagger spec at "./test.yaml" is invalid against swagger specification 2.0.
See errors below:
- could not resolve reference in "/test".POST to $ref : invalid character '-' in numeric literal
```
It is passed on 0.25.0

## Environment
swagger version: 0.26.0
go version: 1.15.6
OS:   Windows 10 Pro 20H2

body:
Facing similar issues! 
`$ swagger version
version: v0.26.0`
`
$ go version
go version go1.15.2 windows/amd64`

OS: Windows 10 Pro

With this release, a lot has changed in the underlying libraries.

On linux everything works fine (see below).

I know that $ref are broken with Windows, but it used to be only some edge case, not the simple case like this.

I've tried to reproduce on linux, and this works fine in my environment. So the problem is really specific to $ref resolution on Windows.

## build from source @v0.26.0
```bash
go mod download
go install github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/cmd/swagger

swagger validate fixture-2492.yaml
2021/01/20 09:45:05 
The swagger spec at "fixture-2492.yaml" is valid against swagger specification 2.0

swagger validate fixture-2493.yaml
2021/01/20 09:45:43 
The swagger spec at "fixture-2493.yaml" is valid against swagger specification 2.0

mkdir gen-2492

swagger generate server -f fixture-2492.yaml --target gen-2492 --quiet && (cd gen-2492/cmd/project-server && go build)
ls gen-2492/cmd/project-server
main.go  project-server

mkdir gen-2493

swagger generate server -f fixture-2493.yaml --target gen-2493 --quiet && (cd gen-2492/cmd/project-server && go build)

ls gen-2493/cmd/server
main.go  server
```

## build from docker @v0.26.0

```bash
mkdir gen-docker-2492

docker run -u $(id -u)\
  -v ${PWD}:/var/input \
 -v ${PWD}/gen-docker-2492:${PWD}/gen-docker-2492  \
 -e GOPATH=${GOPATH} \
 quay.io/goswagger/swagger:v0.26.0 \
 generate server -f /var/input/fixture-2492.yaml --target ${PWD}/gen-docker-2492

(cd gen-docker-2492/cmd/project-server && go build)

ls gen-docker-2492/cmd/project-server
main.go  project-server

mkdir gen-docker-2493

docker run -u $(id -u)\
  -v ${PWD}:/var/input \
 -v ${PWD}/gen-docker-2493:${PWD}/gen-docker-2493  \
 -e GOPATH=${GOPATH} \
 quay.io/goswagger/swagger:v0.26.0 \
 generate server -f /var/input/fixture-2493.yaml --target ${PWD}/gen-docker-2493

(cd gen-docker-2493/cmd/server && go build)

ls gen-docker-2493/cmd/server
main.go  server
```

### build from binary release @v0.26.0
On ubuntu:
```
apt install swagger  # removed configuration step of apt repository etc, for brevity
...
Preparing to unpack .../swagger_0.26.0_amd64.deb ...
Unpacking swagger (0.26.0) ...
Setting up swagger (0.26.0) ...

/usr/bin/swagger version
version: v0.26.0
commit: 640fa2f19f215cda0b815a4bb9a26aae2bd477d2

 /usr/bin/swagger validate fixture-2492.yaml
2021/01/20 10:01:12 
The swagger spec at "fixture-2492.yaml" is valid against swagger specification 2.0

/usr/bin/swagger validate fixture-2493.yaml
2021/01/20 10:01:24 
The swagger spec at "fixture-2493.yaml" is valid against swagger specification 2.0

mkdir gen-binary-2492

/usr/bin/swagger generate server -f fixture-2492.yaml --target gen-binary-2492 --quiet

(cd gen-binary-2492/cmd/project-server && go build)

ls gen-binary-2492/cmd/project-server
main.go  project-server

mkdir gen-binary-2493

/usr/bin/swagger generate server -f fixture-2493.yaml --target gen-binary-2493 --quiet

(cd gen-binary-2493/cmd/server && go build)

ls gen-binary-2493/cmd/server
main.go  server
```
@fredbi Yes, bug seems specific to windows.

I've identified the root cause of this. The problem is a subtle race with various package level init() that set the spec loader.
The symptom you see is a yaml spec incorrectly loaded as json.

The work around pending the fix (probably over next week) is to convert your spec to json.

issue.title: updated go-openapi/spec and go-openapi/loads
issue.body:
* fixes #2492
* fixes #2493
* removed unnecessary init() call in cmd main
* add simple sanity checks for windows on appveyor CI (main test suite remains disabled)

Signed-off-by: Frederic BIDON <fredbi@yahoo.com>

issue.title: Removed call to func init() to initialize PathLoader
issue.body:
PathLoader initialization interferes with other initialization actions from package go-openapi/loads.

This is unfortunate but for now we have to deal with this.

Therefore, we revert PathLoader in the current package to a lazy initialization.

* contributes go-swagger/go-swagger#2492, go-swagger/go-swagger#2493

Signed-off-by: Frederic BIDON <fredbi@yahoo.com>

body:
Are you planning on creating a new release to publishing this fix?

v0.26.0 is last/latest release and it includes this problem.
It can't handle YAML files which include `$ref`.

I think that it doesn't seem healthy.

> Are you planning on creating a new release to publishing this fix?
> 
> v0.26.0 is last/latest release and it includes this problem.
> It can't handle YAML files which include `$ref`.
> 
> I think that it doesn't seem healthy.

Can't you rollback to v0.25.0, until new release?

I did rollback for my works already.

But I don't think it's good for go-swagger to leave a broken release.

The issue affects windows and mac. That's why it  passed under the CI radar.
It is fixed now. We should proceed with a v0.26.1 indeed.

issue.title: run test on GitHub Actions for three platforms
issue.body:
This PR adds GitHub Actions workflow to run test with three OS: Linux (ubuntu), macOS, and Windows.

https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/issues/2492#issuecomment-772332063 might be prevented if there are tests on multiple platform.

So I created it using GitHub Actions.

---

This PR is branched from v0.20.0 for GHA failes on Windows only.
[You can see example run here](https://github.com/koron/loads/actions/runs/536125267)

body: I published the 0.26.1 version, you may need to run `go get -u ./...` in your own project to pick up the latest dependency versions for things like `go-openapi/loads`
